definition[0]: to be confused or shocked by a situation
example[0]: Normanâ€™s brain was reeling, but he did his best to appear calm.
example[1]: The party is still reeling from its recent election defeat.
definition[1]: to step backwards suddenly and almost fall over, especially after being hit or getting a shock
example[3]: The force of the punch sent him reeling against the wall.
definition[2]: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
example[4]: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
definition[3]: to seem to go around and around
example[5]: The room reeled before my eyes and I fainted.
definition[4]: a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
definition[5]: the amount that one of these objects will hold
definition[6]: one of the parts of a cinema film that is contained on a reel
definition[7]: a quick folk dance, especially one from Scotland or Ireland, or the music for this
